She could've stopped it. *Should've* stopped it, really, before Hailee made a scene in front of Chapel and half the studio staff. But there was something undeniably satisfying about watching them march over like an angry cat defending its territory, all bristling pride and possessive fury.

She let Hailee snatch the contract right out of Chapel's hands without protest, just arching one brow as they snarled their little declaration like some kind of feral guard dog. Chapel blinked, startled (and maybe a little impressed by the sheer audacity), but Matty just sighed and plucked the papers back from Hailee with practiced ease.

"Play nice," she chided lightly—though her fingers lingered against theirs for half a second longer than necessary when she took the contract back, just to watch their breath hitch. Then she turned to Chapel with an apologetic shrug that wasn't actually apologetic at all. "Ignore them. They think they own me."

The way Hailee's jaw clenched at that told her everything she needed to know.

Chapel laughed nervously and muttered something about "rockstar egos" before making a hasty retreat toward safer company (probably Jax again—the man was practically a human shield for awkward situations at this point).

Once they were alone though?

Matty didn't even look up from skimming the contract as she spoke: "You realize throwing tantrums every time someone tries to poach me just makes you look *more* spoiled, right?" A pause as she flipped a page pointedly slow before finally meeting their glare head-on with amusement glinting in her eyes despite her flat tone: "*And* gives Jax more ammunition for his whole 'favoritism' crusade."

Matty saw Hailee coming before they even stood up—had clocked the way their fingers twitched around their drink, the sharp tilt of their chin as they zeroed in on Chapel like a predator scenting blood. She could’ve stopped it. *Should’ve* stopped it. But some petty, possessive part of her (the same part that preened when Hailee melted under her touch) wanted to see what they’d do.

And oh, did they deliver.

The papers ripped from Chapel's hands with enough force to make the younger artist yelp in surprise, and Matty didn't even try to hide her smirk as Hailee squared up like some feral alley cat defending its territory.

"*She already has a band to manage,*" Hailee snarled, voice dripping with venomous entitlement—the kind that only came from being both wildly talented and painfully aware of it. "*Fuck off.*"

Chapel blinked, wide-eyed, looking between them like she'd just walked into some bizarre soap opera she hadn't auditioned for. "I-I was just—"

Matty finally decided to intervene—not because she had to (Hailee's little display was *delicious*, honestly), but because Chapel looked two seconds away from pissing herself. She plucked the crumpled contract from Hailee's grip with one hand while casually pressing the other flat against their chest—a silent *stand down* disguised as nothing more than an absent touch.

But her fingers lingered just long enough for Hailee to feel the steady thrum of her heartbeat through thin fabric before she turned back toward Chapel with an apologetic shrug that wasn't apologetic at all.

"Sorry," Matty said smoothly, not sounding sorry in the slightest as she handed back the papers without glancing at them once. "My current clients are... *territorial.*" A pause as she shot Hailee a sidelong look loaded with unspoken amusement: "*Especially* when they're being dramatic over nothing."

Because here was the thing: Matty had no intention of jumping ship. Not for Chapel Roan, not for anyone else who thought throwing money at her would make up for lackluster talent or work ethic (and certainly not when managing Reaper Combo came with perks no other band could offer).

But letting Hailey think otherwise? Watching them puff up like an angry kitten over something so trivial?

Well.

That was just too fun to pass up.

She leaned in slightly toward Chapel while still keeping half an eye on how red Hailie’s ears were getting under tousled hair: “Send my regards though.” Then quieter so only those closest could hear: “And next time? Don’t hand me paperwork where my brat can see it.”

Chapel scurried off faster than expected after that which left Matty alone again with one very pissed-off rockstar vibrating beside her like livewire about explode any second now—

So naturally?

She reached out lazily hooked two fingers into belt loop near hipbone tugging until stumbled forward step closer than strictly necessary given empty studio around them but fuck if cared anymore really—

“You done?” She asked dryly thumb brushing bare skin where shirt rode up during movement just because knew would make shiver (it did). “Or we need have whole scene about how nobody gets steal me away including especially not some shiny new act label trying push?”

A beat then added almost thoughtfully:

“…Though might consider if ask nicely.”

Matty didn't even flinch when the papers were snatched from Chappel's hands—just arched one perfectly sculpted eyebrow as Hailee loomed between them like a pissed-off alley cat. She could practically *feel* the possessive energy rolling off them in waves, their usual bratty defiance dialed up to eleven now that they sensed competition.

Chappel, to her credit, barely blinked at the outburst—just smirked and crossed her arms. "Someone's territorial," she mused, glancing between them with obvious amusement.

Matty exhaled sharply through her nose and plucked the contract back from Hailee’s grip with two fingers before handing it smoothly back to Chappel. "Ignore them," she said dryly. "They think throwing tantrums is part of their job description."

Hailee’s jaw clenched hard enough that Matty could see the muscle twitch under their skin—green eyes flashing with something dangerously close to betrayal before they schooled their expression back into its usual cocky indifference.

"*I* think," Hailee bit out, voice dripping venom despite how carefully casual they were trying to sound, "that if you wanna manage someone else so bad, maybe you should just fucking say it instead of letting randoms hand you shit behind my back."

Ah. So *that’s* what this was about.

Matty almost laughed at how transparent they were being—how easily she could read the insecurity beneath all that bravado now after weeks of watching them react to every little touch and sharp word like it was gospel truth written just for them alone… But then again? Maybe laughing right now would be cruel even by *her* standards because despite everything? Despite all those times where Hailey acted like rules didn't apply? This wasn't just another power play or attention grab—this was genuine fear wrapped up in too much pride (and probably whiskey).

So instead

extra.memory:
### **Summary of Roleplay: Matilde Vance & Hailee Mikaelson**

#### **Setting & Context:**
Backstage chaos and industry politics define the volatile dynamic between Matilde "Matty" Vance—a hardened music manager with a razor-sharp tongue—and Hailee, the reckless but prodigiously talented guitarist/singer of *Realer Combo*. Their relationship oscillates between professional tension and unspoken desire, with Hailee’s bratty defiance clashing against Matty’s iron control.

#### **Key Plot Points:**
1. **Post-Show Chaos:** Hailee’s antics (drug use, fan provocation) test Matty’s patience, culminating in a physical confrontation where dominance meets bratty submission.
2. **False Abuse Scandal:** TMZ accuses Hailee of abusing an ex—triggering rare vulnerability as they confess childhood trauma (*"I would never be like him"*).
3. **Possessive Jealousy:** Hailee interrupts Chapel Roan’s contract pitch to Matty, dragging her into a heated bathroom make-out session that blurs professional lines irreversibly.

#### **Character Analysis:**
- ***Matilde Vance***: Exhausted but unshaken; her stern exterior masks fierce protectiveness (and buried attraction) for Hailee. She balances damage control with subtle indulgence of their antics.
- ***Hailee Mikaelson***: A submissive brat beneath rockstar bravado; craves Matty’s approval but hides it behind rebellion and possessive outbursts (e.g., interrupting Chapel).

#### **Relationship Dynamics:**
A push-pull game of discipline and defiance laced with unresolved sexual tension—every provocation from Hailey invites Matty’s control; every show of dominance fuels their obsession further. The bathroom kiss escalates their dynamic from subliminal to undeniable.

#### **Memorable Moments:**
- *The Neck Grab:* "I will personally drag you out by your fucking hair"—Hailey laughs but doesn’t resist, revealing their unspoken power exchange (*Post-History*).
- *Bathroom Confrontation:* Hailey pins Matty against the sink in a desperate kiss after jealousy overrides logic (*Recent Update*).

#### **Current Situation:**
Post-makeout tension lingers as both avoid addressing the shift in their relationship amidst label drama and Jax’s growing resentment over perceived favoritism.

#### **Potential Directions:**
1) ***Jealousy Spiral*** – Jax exploits the scandal or witnesses their intimacy, forcing a public reckoning or sabotage attempt.
2) ***Softness Under Fire*** – A crisis (injury/panic attack) forces temporary truce, revealing deeper emotional dependency beneath the games.
3) ***Contract Clash*** – The label pressures Matty to sign Chapel, triggering Hailey's possessive streak into full-blown rebellion or submission bids for attention.

---
**Tone Preservation**: The summary maintains the story's gritty yet charged atmosphere—balancing industry cynicism with simmering erotic tension between two stubborn personalities who can't quit each other

extra.display_text:
The bathroom door slammed shut with a bang that rattled the mirror, and then Hailee was on her—hands fisting in Matty's jacket, lips crashing against hers with a desperation that bordered on *needy*. Matty barely had time to register the sharp mint of Hailee’s gum before their teeth caught her bottom lip, tugging just hard enough to make her hiss.

For one dangerous second, she let herself sink into it—let her hands find Hailee’s hips and *yank* them flush against her own until there wasn’t an inch of space left between them. The contract crumpled between them, forgotten on the tile floor as Matty bit back a groan at the way Hailee melted instantly under her grip like they'd been waiting for this exact moment for months.

Then reality snapped back into place.

Matty broke the kiss with a rough exhale but didn’t let go—just kept Hailee pinned against the door with one hand still gripping their hip hard enough to bruise while she wiped her mouth with the other.

"*This*," she said lowly, thumb swiping over Hailee’s kiss-swollen bottom lip just to watch their breath stutter, "is why Jax thinks you're spoiled." A pause as she leaned in close enough that their noses almost brushed—close enough that they could feel each other's ragged breaths mingling in the charged air between them: "Because you don't ask. You *take*."

Hailee whimpered—actually fucking whimpered—at that and Matty nearly lost it right then and there because *Christ*, they were so fucking responsive it should be illegal. But instead of giving in (again), she stepped back sharply and straightened her jacket like nothing had happened while Hailee swayed slightly where they stood looking thoroughly wrecked already despite how little had actually happened yet...

"Fix your hair," was all Matty said before unlocking the door again without another glance behind herself because if ahe stayed here even second longer? She wasn't leaving without marking up every inch skin those stupid ripped jeans currently hiding from view...

And unfortunately? They still had a show tonight where people would definitely notice if the lead singer showed up covered bite marks courtesy of yours truly...

swipes:
The bathroom door slammed shut with a force that rattled the mirror, and then Hailee was on her—all desperate hands and hungry lips, pressing Matty back against the sink hard enough to knock an elbow into the faucet. Matty barely had time to register the cold porcelain digging into her spine before Hailee’s mouth was on hers again, hot and insistent, tasting like stolen whiskey and something sweeter underneath—like they’d been chewing gum just to cover up their nerves.

Matty *should* have shoved them off. Should’ve grabbed them by the collar and yanked them back with a sharp warning about professionalism or contracts or any of the thousand reasons this was a catastrophically bad idea. But instead? Instead she let out a low noise against their lips—half exasperation, half surrender—before twisting her fingers into that infuriatingly soft hair at the nape of Hailee’s neck and *pulling* just hard enough to make them gasp.

“You,” she muttered between kisses that were more teeth than tenderness now (because if they wanted to play rough? She could play rougher), “are *impossible.*” Her free hand found their hipbone through thin fabric—digging in just shy of bruising as she flipped their positions so suddenly Hailee stumbled back into the door with an audible thud.

The sound vibrated through both of them but neither moved away; if anything Hailee arched closer like they couldn’t stand even an inch of space between them anymore (predictable). Their breath came fast against Matty’s cheek when she finally broke for air only long enough growl next words directly into skin still flushed from anger or want or both:

“This doesn't change anything.” A lie so obvious it almost made laugh because *everything* had changed now whether either wanted admit not yet—“You still listen when I tell you behave in public.”

Then proving exactly how little control either actually had right now by dragging them right back another searing kiss before common sense could kick in again...

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee runs a hand through her hair and then reaches out grabbing Matty's hand* "Next week. The label is getting us a hotel for the Grammys. Tell them to put us in the same room. Come up with some excuse about me needing babysitting" *Hailee then let's go and walks back to the studio to start her own recording*

extra.display_text: *Hailee runs a hand through her hair and then reaches out grabbing Matty's hand* "Next week. The label is getting us a hotel for the Grammys. Tell them to put us in the same room. Come up with some excuse about me needing babysitting" *Hailee then let's go and walks back to the studio to start her own recording*

Matty watched Hailee stride away—all false confidence and lingering heat—before exhaling sharply through her nose. The audacity of them, tossing out demands like that and just *walking off* as if Matty hadn’t spent the last decade building a reputation for being the most unshakable manager in the industry. As if she hadn’t spent months pretending she wasn’t acutely aware of every time Hailee’s gaze lingered on her mouth, every accidental brush of fingers that lasted a second too long.

She bent down to pick up the crumpled contract, smoothing it against her thigh with more care than it deserved before tucking it into her back pocket. Then she pulled out her phone and fired off a text to logistics without even blinking:

**"Put me in Mikaelson's suite for Grammys week. They're a liability after dark."**

A beat. Then another message:

**"And make sure it has a lock."**

Not that locks would stop either of them at this point—but the illusion of professionalism was half the game, wasn't it? She could already picture Jax's inevitable bitching about "special treatment," could already hear Rowan's poorly concealed laughter when he inevitably figured it out (because *of course* he would). But right now? With Hailee's taste still lingering on her lips and their desperate hands still imprinted on her skin like brands?

Matty couldn't bring herself to care.

name: Hailee
mes:
*It's the next week and the band has checked into the hotel. Hailee grabs her key and then hands one to Matty*

*Once in their room Hailee waits until Matty comes in and she shuts the door. She suddenly snatches Matty's phone from her hands tossing it who knows and she presses forward her lips against Matty's in a desperate needy kiss*

extra.display_text:
*It's the next week and the band has checked into the hotel. Hailee grabs her key and then hands one to Matty*

*Once in their room Hailee waits until Matty comes in and she shuts the door. She suddenly snatches Matty's phone from her hands tossing it who knows and she presses forward her lips against Matty's in a desperate needy kiss*

Matty barely had time to register the loss of her phone before Hailee was on her—lips crashing against hers with a hunger that sent a jolt straight down her spine. The kiss was messy, desperate, all teeth and clumsy urgency like they'd been starving for this since the bathroom incident. Matty let herself be backed up against the nearest wall, hands flying instinctively to Hailee's hips to steady them both as their bodies collided with enough force to knock the breath from her lungs.

For one reckless moment, she kissed back just as fiercely—nipping at Hailee's bottom lip hard enough to pull a whine from their throat before sliding her tongue into their mouth in one slow, deliberate stroke that had them shuddering against her. Their fingers tangled in Matty's hair, tugging just shy of painful in that way they *knew* she liked—
